intro: Coluteastrum brachystachyum, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed cowplant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, with a rough texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and forest edges.
